article.headline: UC Irvine 71, UC Riverside 61
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. (AP) --UC Irvine remained undefeated in Big West Conference play with a 71-61 win over UC Riverside on Thursday. The Anteaters (9-8, 5-0) led by as many as 25 points in the first half, but Riverside (2-14, 2-4) rallied to within three points in the second half before Irvine pulled away in the game's final minutes. Adam Templeton led Irvine with 18 points and seven rebounds. UC Riverside's Steve Williams shot 9-of-17 from the field and ended with a game-high 23 points. UC Irvine opened the game with 17 straight points and led 37-12 with 6:12 remaining in the first half before Riverside closed the half with a 17-4 run to trail at halftime 41-29. The Anteaters, who rank second in the nation in 3-point field goal percentage, made 7-of-15 from behind the arc in the first half, led by Nick Campbell's three 3-pointers. A 19-5 run by the Highlanders pulled them to within three points of Irvine at 59-56 with 5:06 remaining, but the Anteaters outscored Riverside 12-5 the rest of the way.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
